28.15: And you have made a breastplate of judgment, the work of a designer; you make it according to the work of the ephod; you make it of gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and twined linen;
28.16: it is square, doubled, a span its length, and a span its breadth.
28.17: And you have set settings of stone in it, four rows of stone: a row of sardius, topaz, and carbuncle [is] the first row;
28.18: and the second row [is] emerald, sapphire, and diamond;
28.19: and the third row [is] opal, agate, and amethyst;
28.20: and the fourth row [is] beryl, and onyx, and jasper; they are embroidered with gold in their settings,
28.21: and the stones are according to the names of the sons of Israel, twelve according to their names, [as] engravings of a signet, each with his name; they are for the twelve tribes.
28.22: And you have made wreathed chains on the breastplate, [the] work of thick bands of pure gold;
28.23: and you have made two rings of gold on the breastplate, and have put the two rings on the two ends of the breastplate;
28.24: and you have put the two thick bands of gold on the two rings at the ends of the breastplate;
28.25: and you put the two ends of the two thick bands on the two filigrees, and you have put [them] on the shoulders of the ephod toward the front of its face.
28.26: And you have made two rings of gold, and have set them on the two ends of the breastplate, on its border, which [is] toward the side of the ephod within it;
28.27: and you have made two rings of gold, and have put them on the two shoulders of the ephod, from beneath, in front of its face, close by its joining, above the girdle of the ephod,
28.28: and they bind the breastplate by its rings to the rings of the ephod with a ribbon of blue, to be above the girdle of the ephod, and the breastplate is not loosed from the ephod.
28.29: And Aaron has borne the names of the sons of Israel in the breastplate of judgment, on his heart, in his going into the holy place, for a memorial before YHWH continually.
28.30: And you have put the Lights and the Perfections into the breastplate of judgment, and they have been on the heart of Aaron, in his going in before YHWH, and Aaron has borne the judgment of the sons of Israel on his heart before YHWH continually.
28.31: And you have made the upper robe of the ephod completely of blue,
28.32: and the opening for his head has been in its midst; there is a border for its opening all around—the work of a weaver—[and] there is as the opening of a [linen] habergeon for it; it is not torn.
28.33: And you have made on its hem pomegranates of blue, and purple, and scarlet, on its hem all around, and bells of gold in their midst all around;
28.34: a bell of gold and a pomegranate [and] a bell of gold and a pomegranate [are] on the hems of the upper robe all around.
28.35: And it has been on Aaron to minister in, and its sound has been heard in his coming into the holy place before YHWH, and in his going out, and he does not die.
28.36: And you have made a flower of pure gold, and have engraved engravings of a signet on it: Holy to YHWH;
28.37: and you have put it on a blue ribbon, and it has been on the turban—it is toward the front of the face of the turban;
28.38: and it has been on the forehead of Aaron, and Aaron has borne the iniquity of the holy things which the sons of Israel hallow, even all their holy gifts; and it has been on his forehead continually for a pleasing thing for them before YHWH.
28.39: And you have embroidered the coat of linen, and have made a turban of linen, and you make a girdle—the work of an embroiderer.
28.40: And you make coats for the sons of Aaron, and you have made girdles for them, and you make caps for them, for glory and for beauty;
28.41: and you have clothed your brother Aaron with them, and his sons with him, and have anointed them, and have consecrated their hand, and have sanctified them, and they have been priests to Me.
28.42: And make linen trousers for them to cover the naked flesh; they are from the loins even to the thighs;
28.43: and they have been on Aaron and on his sons in their going into the Tent of Meeting, or in their drawing near to the altar to minister in the holy place, and they do not bear iniquity nor have they died; [it is] a continuous statute to him and to his seed after him.”

29.1: “And this [is] the thing which you do to them, to hallow them, for being priests to Me: take one bullock, a son of the herd, and two rams, perfect ones,
29.2: and unleavened bread, and unleavened cakes anointed with oil; you make them of fine wheat flour,
29.3: and you have put them on one basket, and have brought them near in the basket, also the bullock and the two rams.
29.4: And you bring Aaron and his sons near to the opening of the Tent of Meeting, and have bathed them with water;
29.5: and you have taken the garments, and have clothed Aaron with the coat, and the upper robe of the ephod, and the ephod, and the breastplate, and have girded him with the girdle of the ephod,
29.6: and have set the turban on his head, and have put the holy crown on the turban,
29.7: and have taken the anointing oil, and have poured [it] on his head, and have anointed him.
29.8: And you bring his sons near, and have clothed them [with] coats,
29.9: and have girded them [with] a girdle (Aaron and his sons), and have bound caps on them; and the priesthood has been theirs by a continuous statute, and you have consecrated the hand of Aaron, and the hand of his sons,
29.10: and have brought the bullock near before the Tent of Meeting, and Aaron has laid—his sons also—their hands on the head of the bullock.
29.11: And you have slaughtered the bullock before YHWH, at the opening of the Tent of Meeting,
29.12: and have taken of the blood of the bullock, and have put [it] on the horns of the altar with your finger, and you pour out all the blood at the foundation of the altar;
29.13: and you have taken all the fat which is covering the innards, and the redundance on the liver, and the two kidneys, and the fat which [is] on them, and have made incense on the altar;
29.14: and the flesh of the bullock, and his skin, and his dung, you burn with fire at the outside of the camp; it [is] a sin-offering.
29.15: And you take the first ram, and Aaron and his sons have laid their hands on the head of the ram,
29.16: and you have slaughtered the ram, and have taken its blood, and have sprinkled [it] around the altar,
29.17: and you cut the ram into its pieces, and have washed its innards, and its legs, and have put [them] on its pieces, and on its head;
29.18: and you have made incense with the whole ram on the altar. It [is] a burnt-offering to YHWH, a refreshing fragrance; it [is] a fire-offering to YHWH.
29.19: And you have taken the second ram, and Aaron has laid—his sons also—their hands on the head of the ram,
29.20: and you have slaughtered the ram, and have taken of its blood, and have put [it] on the tip of the right ear of Aaron, and on the tip of the right ear of his sons, and on the thumb of their right hand, and on the great toe of their right foot, and have sprinkled the blood around the altar;
29.21: and you have taken of the blood which [is] on the altar, and of the anointing oil, and have sprinkled [it] on Aaron, and on his garments, and on his sons, and on the garments of his sons with him, and he has been hallowed, he and his garments, and his sons, and the garments of his sons with him.
29.22: And you have taken from the ram the fat, and the fat tail, and the fat which is covering the innards, and the redundance on the liver, and the two kidneys, and the fat which [is] on them, and the right leg, for it [is] a ram of consecration,
29.23: and one round cake of bread, and one cake of oiled bread, and one thin cake out of the basket of the unleavened things which [is] before YHWH;
29.24: and you have set the whole on the hands of Aaron, and on the hands of his sons, and have waved them [for] a wave-offering before YHWH;
29.25: and you have taken them out of their hand, and have made incense on the altar beside the burnt-offering, for refreshing fragrance before YHWH; it [is] a fire-offering to YHWH.
29.26: And you have taken the breast from the ram of the consecration which [is] for Aaron, and have waved it [for] a wave-offering before YHWH, and it has become your portion;
29.27: and you have sanctified the breast of the wave-offering, and the leg of the raised-offering, which has been waved, and which has been lifted up from the ram of the consecration, of that which [is] for Aaron, and of that which [is] for his sons;
29.28: and it has been for Aaron and for his sons, by a continuous statute from the sons of Israel, for it [is] a raised-offering; and it is a raised-offering from the sons of Israel, from the sacrifices of their peace-offerings—their raised-offering to YHWH.
29.29: And the holy garments which are Aaron’s are for his sons after him, to be anointed in them and to consecrate their hand in them;
29.30: [for] seven days the priest in his stead (of his sons) puts them on when he goes into the Tent of Meeting to minister in the holy place.
29.31: And you take the ram of the consecration and have boiled its flesh in the holy place;
29.32: and Aaron has eaten—his sons also—the flesh of the ram, and the bread which [is] in the basket, at the opening of the Tent of Meeting;
29.33: and they have eaten those things by which there is atonement to consecrate their hand, to sanctify them; and a stranger does not eat [them], for they [are] holy;
29.34: and if there is left of the flesh of the consecration or of the bread until the morning, then you have burned that which is left with fire; it is not eaten, for it [is] holy.
29.35: And you have done thus to Aaron and to his sons, according to all that I have commanded you; [for] seven days you consecrate their hand;
29.36: and a bullock, a sin-offering, you prepare daily for the atonements, and you have atoned for the altar in your making atonement on it, and have anointed it to sanctify it;
29.37: [for] seven days you make atonement for the altar, and have sanctified it, and the altar has been most holy; all that is coming against the altar is holy.
29.38: And this [is] that which you prepare on the altar: two lambs, sons of a year, daily continually;
29.39: you prepare the first lamb in the morning, and you prepare the second lamb between the evenings;
29.40: and a tenth part of fine flour mixed with a fourth part of a hin of beaten oil, and a fourth part of a hin of wine [for] a drink-offering, [is] for the first lamb.
29.41: And you prepare the second lamb between the evenings; according to the present of the morning, and according to its drink-offering, you prepare for it, for refreshing fragrance, a fire-offering to YHWH—
29.42: a continual burnt-offering for your generations [at] the opening of the Tent of Meeting before YHWH, to where I meet with you to speak to you there,
29.43: and I have met with the sons of Israel there, and it has been sanctified by My glory.
29.44: And I have sanctified the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and I sanctify Aaron and his sons for being priests to Me,
29.45: and I have dwelt in the midst of the sons of Israel, and have become their God,
29.46: and they have known that I [am] their God YHWH, who has brought them out of the land of Egypt, that I may dwell in their midst; I [am] their God YHWH.”

30.1: “And you have made an altar [for] making incense; you make it of shittim wood;
30.2: a cubit its length and a cubit its breadth (it is square), and two cubits its height; its horns [are] of the same.
30.3: And you have overlaid it with pure gold—its top, and around its sides, and its horns; and you have made a crown of gold for it all around;
30.4: and you make two rings of gold for it, under its crown on its two ribs; you make [them] on its two sides, and they have become places for poles to carry it with them.
30.5: And you have made the poles of shittim wood, and have overlaid them with gold;
30.6: and you have put it before the veil, which [is] by the Ark of the Testimony, before the propitiatory covering which [is] over the Testimony, where I meet with you.
30.7: And Aaron has made incense on it, incense of spices, morning by morning; in his making the lamps right, he makes incense [on] it,
30.8: and in Aaron’s causing the lamps to go up between the evenings, he makes incense [on] it; [it is] a continual incense before YHWH throughout your generations.
30.9: You do not cause strange incense to go up on it—and burnt-offering and present; and you do not pour out a drink-offering on it;
30.10: and Aaron has made atonement on its horns once in a year, by the blood of the sin-offering of atonements; once in a year he makes atonement for it, throughout your generations; it [is] most holy to YHWH.”
30.11: And YHWH speaks to Moses, saying,
30.12: “When you take up the census of the sons of Israel for their numbers, then they have each given an atonement [for] his soul to YHWH in their being numbered, and there is no plague among them in their being numbered.
30.13: This they give, everyone passing over to those numbered, half a shekel, by the shekel of the holy place (the shekel [is] twenty gerahs); half a shekel [is] the raised-offering to YHWH;
30.14: everyone passing over to those numbered, from a son of twenty years and upwards, gives the raised-offering of YHWH;
30.15: the rich do not multiply, and the poor do not diminish from the half-shekel, to give the raised-offering of YHWH, to make atonement for your souls.
30.16: And you have taken the atonement-money from the sons of Israel, and have given it for the service of the Tent of Meeting; and it has been to the sons of Israel for a memorial before YHWH, to make atonement for your souls.”
30.17: And YHWH speaks to Moses, saying,
30.18: “And you have made a laver of bronze (and its base of bronze), for washing; and you have put it between the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and have put water [in] there,
30.19: and Aaron and his sons have washed their hands and their feet from it;
30.20: they wash [with] water in their going into the Tent of Meeting, and do not die; or in their drawing near to the altar to minister, to make incense [as] a fire-offering to YHWH,
30.21: then they have washed their hands and their feet, and they do not die, and it has been a continuous statute to them, to him and to his seed, throughout their generations.”
30.22: And YHWH speaks to Moses, saying,
30.23: “And you, take [these] principal spices for yourself: five hundred [shekels] of liquid myrrh, and the half of that—two hundred and fifty [shekels]—of spice-cinnamon, and two hundred and fifty [shekels] of spice-cane,
30.24: and five hundred [shekels] of cassia, by the shekel of the holy place, and a hin of olive oil;
30.25: and you have made it a holy anointing oil, a compound mixture, work of a compounder; it is a holy anointing oil.
30.26: And with it you have anointed the Tent of Meeting, and the Ark of the Testimony,
30.27: and the table and all its vessels, and the lampstand and its vessels, and the altar of incense,
30.28: and the altar of burnt-offering and all its vessels, and the laver and its base;
30.29: and you have sanctified them, and they have been most holy; all that is coming against them is holy;
30.30: and you anoint Aaron and his sons, and have sanctified them for being priests to Me.
30.31: And you speak to the sons of Israel, saying, This is a holy anointing oil to Me, throughout your generations;
30.32: it is not poured on [the] flesh of man, and you make nothing [else] like it in its proportion; it [is] holy—it is holy to you;
30.33: a man who compounds [any] like it, or who puts of it on a stranger, has even been cut off from his people.”
30.34: And YHWH says to Moses, “Take to yourself spices—stacte, and onycha, and galbanum—spices and pure frankincense; they are part for part;
30.35: and you have made it an incense, a compound, work of a compounder, salted, pure, holy;
30.36: and you have beaten [some] of it small, and have put of it before the Testimony in the Tent of Meeting, to where I meet with you; it is most holy to you.
30.37: As for the incense which you make, you do not make [any] for yourselves in its proportion; it is holy to you for YHWH;
30.38: a man who makes [any] like it—to be refreshed by it—has even been cut off from his people.”

31.1: And YHWH speaks to Moses, saying,
31.2: “See, I have called by name Bezaleel, son of Uri, son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah,
31.3: and I fill him [with] the Spirit of God, in wisdom, and in understanding, and in knowledge, and in all work,
31.4: to devise inventions to work in gold, and in silver, and in bronze,
31.5: and in a carving of stone for settings, and in a carving of wood to work in all work.
31.6: And I, behold, have given with him Aholiab, son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, and I have given wisdom in the heart of every wise-hearted one, and they have made all that which I have commanded you.
31.7: The Tent of Meeting, and the Ark of Testimony, and the propitiatory covering which [is] on it, and all the vessels of the tent,
31.8: and the table and its vessels, and the pure lampstand and all its vessels, and the altar of the incense,
31.9: and the altar of the burnt-offering and all its vessels, and the laver and its base,
31.10: and the colored garments, and the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons, for acting as priests in;
31.11: and the anointing oil, and the incense of the spices for the holy place; according to all that I have commanded you—they do.”
31.12: And YHWH speaks to Moses, saying,
31.13: “And you, speak to the sons of Israel, saying, Surely you keep My Sabbaths, for it [is] a sign between Me and you throughout your generations, to know that I, YHWH, am sanctifying you;
31.14: and you have kept the Sabbath, for it [is] holy to you, he who is defiling it is certainly put to death—for any who does work in it—that person has even been cut off from the midst of his people.
31.15: [For] six days work is done, and in the seventh day [is] a Sabbath of holy rest to YHWH; any who does work in the Sabbath day is certainly put to death,
31.16: and the sons of Israel have observed the Sabbath; to keep the Sabbath throughout their generations [is] a perpetual covenant—
31.17: it [is] a sign between Me and the sons of Israel for all time; for [in] six days YHWH made the heavens and the earth, and in the seventh day He has ceased and is refreshed.”
31.18: And He gives to Moses, when He finishes speaking with him in Mount Sinai, two tablets of the Testimony, tablets of stone, written by the finger of God.

32.1: And the people see that Moses is delaying to come down from the mountain, and the people assemble against Aaron, and say to him, “Rise, make gods for us, who go before us, for this Moses—the man who brought us up out of the land of Egypt—we have not known what has happened to him.”
32.2: And Aaron says to them, “Break off the rings of gold which [are] in the ears of your wives, your sons, and your daughters, and bring [them] to me”;
32.3: and all the people break off the rings of gold which [are] in their ears, and bring [them] to Aaron,
32.4: and he receives [it] from their hand, and fashions it with an engraving tool, and makes it [into] a molten calf, and they say, “These [are] your gods, O Israel, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt!”
32.5: And Aaron sees, and builds an altar before it, and Aaron calls, and says, “A festival to YHWH—tomorrow”;
32.6: and they rise early on the next day, and cause burnt-offerings to ascend, and bring peace-offerings near; and the people sit down to eat and to drink, and rise up to play.
32.7: And YHWH says to Moses, “Go, descend, for your people whom you have brought up out of the land of Egypt have done corruptly,
32.8: they have quickly turned aside from the way that I have commanded them; they have made a molten calf for themselves, and bow themselves to it, and sacrifice to it, and say, These [are] your gods, O Israel, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt!”
32.9: And YHWH says to Moses, “I have seen this people, and behold, it [is] a stiff-necked people;
32.10: and now, leave Me alone, and My anger burns against them, and I consume them, and I make you become a great nation.”
32.11: And Moses appeases the face of his God YHWH and says, “Why, O YHWH, does Your anger burn against Your people, whom You have brought forth out of the land of Egypt with great power and with a strong hand?
32.12: Why do the Egyptians speak, saying, He brought them out in calamity to slay them among mountains, and to consume them from off the face of the ground? Turn back from the heat of Your anger, and relent from this calamity against Your people.
32.13: Be mindful of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Israel, Your servants, to whom You have sworn by Yourself, and to whom You speak: I multiply your seed as stars of the heavens, and all this land, as I have said, I give to your seed, and they have inherited [it] for all time”;
32.14: and YHWH relents from the evil which He has spoken of doing to His people.
32.15: And Moses turns, and goes down from the mountain, and the two tablets of the Testimony [are] in his hand, tablets written on both their sides; they [are] written on this [side] and on that [side];
32.16: and the tablets are the work of God, and the writing is the writing of God, engraved on the tablets.
32.17: And Joshua hears the voice of the people in their shouting and says to Moses, “A noise of battle in the camp!”
32.18: And he says, “It is not the voice of the crying of might, nor is it the voice of the crying of weakness—I am hearing a voice of singing.”
32.19: And it comes to pass, when he has drawn near to the camp, that he sees the calf, and the dancing, and the anger of Moses burns, and he casts the tablets out of his hands, and breaks them below the mountain;
32.20: and he takes the calf which they have made, and burns [it] with fire, and grinds [it] until [it is] small, and scatters [it] on the face of the waters, and causes the sons of Israel to drink.
32.21: And Moses says to Aaron, “What has this people done to you, that you have brought in a great sin on it?”
32.22: And Aaron says, “Do not let the anger of my lord burn; you have known the people, that it [is beset] with evil;
32.23: and they say to me, Make gods for us, who go before us, for this Moses—the man who brought us up out of the land of Egypt—we have not known what has happened to him;
32.24: and I say to them, Whoever has gold, let them break [it] off, and they give [it] to me, and I cast it into the fire, and this calf comes out.”
32.25: And Moses sees the people, that it [is] unbridled, for Aaron has made it unbridled for contempt among its withstanders,
32.26: and Moses stands in the gate of the camp and says, “Who [is] for YHWH? [Come] to me!” And all the sons of Levi are gathered to him;
32.27: and he says to them, “Thus said YHWH, God of Israel: Each put his sword by his thigh, pass over and turn back from gate to gate through the camp, and each slay his brother, and each his friend, and each his relation.”
32.28: And the sons of Levi do according to the word of Moses, and there falls of the people on that day about three thousand men,
32.29: and Moses says, “Consecrate your hand to YHWH today, for a man [is] against his son, and against his brother, so as to bring a blessing on you today.”
32.30: And it comes to pass, on the next day, that Moses says to the people, “You have sinned a great sin, and now I go up to YHWH, perhaps I can atone for your sin.”
32.31: And Moses turns back to YHWH and says, “Ah, now this people has sinned a great sin, that they make a god of gold for themselves;
32.32: and now, if You take away their sin—and if not—please blot me out of Your scroll which You have written.”
32.33: And YHWH says to Moses, “Whoever has sinned against Me—I blot him out of My scroll;
32.34: and now, go, lead the people wherever I have spoken to you of; behold, My Messenger goes before you, and in the day of my charging—then I have charged their sin on them.”
32.35: And YHWH plagues the people because they made the calf which Aaron made.

33.1: And YHWH speaks to Moses, “Go, ascend from this [place], you and the people, whom you have brought up out of the land of Egypt, to the land which I have sworn to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, saying, I give it to your seed.
33.2: And I have sent a Messenger before you, and have cast out the Canaanite, the Amorite, and the Hittite, and the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite.
33.3: [Go up] to a land flowing with milk and honey, for I do not go up in your midst, for you [are] a stiff-necked people—lest I consume you in the way.”
33.4: And the people hear this sad thing, and mourn; and none puts his ornaments on him.
33.5: And YHWH says to Moses, “Say to the sons of Israel: You [are] a stiff-necked people; [in] one moment I could come up into your midst and could have consumed you; and now, put down your ornaments from off you, and I know what I do to you”;
33.6: and the sons of Israel take off their ornaments at Mount Horeb.
33.7: And Moses takes the tent, and has stretched it out at the outside of the camp, far off from the camp, and has called it, “Tent of Meeting”; and it has come to pass, everyone seeking YHWH goes out to the Tent of Meeting, which [is] at the outside of the camp.
33.8: And it has come to pass, at the going out of Moses to the tent, all the people rise, and have stood, each at the opening of his tent, and have looked expectingly after Moses, until his going into the tent.
33.9: And it has come to pass, at the going in of Moses to the tent, the pillar of the cloud comes down, and has stood at the opening of the tent, and He has spoken with Moses;
33.10: and all the people have seen the pillar of the cloud standing at the opening of the tent, and all the people have risen and bowed themselves, each at the opening of his tent.
33.11: And YHWH has spoken to Moses face to face, as a man speaks to his friend; and he has turned back to the camp, and his minister Joshua, son of Nun, a youth, does not depart out of the tent.
33.12: And Moses says to YHWH, “See, You are saying to me, Bring up this people, and You have not caused me to know whom You send with me; and You have said, I have known you by name, and you have also found grace in My eyes.
33.13: And now, if, please, I have found grace in Your eyes, please cause me to know Your way, and I know You, so that I find grace in Your eyes, and consider that this nation [is] Your people”;
33.14: and He says, “My presence goes, and I have given rest to you.”
33.15: And he says to Him, “If Your presence is not going—do not take us up from this [place];
33.16: and in what is it known now, that I have found grace in Your eyes—I and Your people—is it not in Your going with us? And we have been distinguished—I and Your people—from all the people who [are] on the face of the ground.”
33.17: And YHWH says to Moses, “Even this thing which you have spoken I do; for you have found grace in My eyes, and I know you by name.”
33.18: And he says, “Please show me Your glory”;
33.19: and He says, “I cause all My goodness to pass before your face, and have called concerning the Name of YHWH before you, and favored him whom I favor, and loved him whom I love.”
33.20: He also says, “You are unable to see My face, for man does not see Me and live”;
33.21: YHWH also says, “Behold, a place [is] by Me, and you have stood on the rock,
33.22: and it has come to pass, in the passing by of My glory, that I have set you in a cleft of the rock, and spread out My hands over you until My passing by,
33.23: and I have turned aside My hands, and you have seen My back parts, and My face is not seen.”

34.1: And YHWH says to Moses, “Hew for yourself two tablets of stone like the first, and I have written on the tablets the words which were on the first tablets which you have broken;
34.2: and be prepared at morning, and you have come up in the morning to Mount Sinai, and have stood before Me there, on the top of the mountain,
34.3: and no man comes up with you, and also no man is seen in all the mountain, also the flock and the herd do not feed toward the front of that mountain.”
34.4: And he hews two tablets of stone like the first, and Moses rises early in the morning, and goes up to Mount Sinai as YHWH commanded him, and takes [the] two tablets of stone in his hand.
34.5: And YHWH comes down in a cloud, and stations Himself with him there, and calls in the Name of YHWH,
34.6: and YHWH passes over before his face, and calls: “YHWH, YHWH God, merciful and gracious, slow to anger, and abundant in kindness and truth,
34.7: keeping kindness for thousands, taking away iniquity, and transgression, and sin, and not entirely acquitting, charging iniquity of fathers on sons and on sons’ sons, on a third and on a fourth [generation].”
34.8: And Moses hurries, and bows to the earth, and pays respect,
34.9: and says, “Now if I have found grace in Your eyes, O my Lord, please let my Lord go in our midst (for it [is] a stiff-necked people), and you have forgiven our iniquity and our sin, and have inherited us.”
34.10: And He says, “Behold, I am making a covenant. I do wonders before all your people, which have not been done in all the earth, or in any nation, and all the people in whose midst you [are in] have seen the work of YHWH, for it [is] fearful—that which I am doing with you.
34.11: Observe for yourself that which I am commanding you today. Behold, I am casting out from before you the Amorite, and the Canaanite, and the Hittite, and the Perizzite, and the Hivite, and the Jebusite;
34.12: take heed to yourself lest you make a covenant with the inhabitant of the land into which you are going, lest it become a snare in your midst;
34.13: for you break down their altars, and you shatter their standing pillars, and you cut down its Asherim;
34.14: for you do not bow yourselves to another god—for YHWH, whose Name [is] Zealous, is a zealous God.
34.15: Lest you make a covenant with the inhabitant of the land, and they have gone whoring after their gods, and have sacrificed to their gods, and [one] has called to you, and you have eaten of his sacrifice,
34.16: and you have taken of their daughters for your sons, and their daughters have gone whoring after their gods, and have caused your sons to go whoring after their gods;
34.17: you do not make a molten god for yourself.
34.18: You keep the Celebration of Unleavened Things; [for] seven days you eat unleavened things, as I have commanded you, at an appointed time, [in] the month of Abib: for in the month of Abib you came out from Egypt.
34.19: All opening a womb [are] Mine, and every firstling of your livestock born a male, [whether] ox or sheep;
34.20: and you ransom the firstling of a donkey with a lamb; and if you do not ransom, then you have beheaded it; you ransom every firstborn of your sons, and they do not appear before Me empty.
34.21: [For] six days you work, and on the seventh day you rest; in plowing-time and in harvest you rest.
34.22: And you observe [the] Celebration of Weeks for yourself, of [the] first-fruits of wheat-harvest; and the Celebration of Ingathering at the revolution of the year.
34.23: Three times in a year all your males appear before the Lord YHWH, God of Israel;
34.24: for I dispossess nations from before you, and have enlarged your border, and no man desires your land in your going up to appear before your God YHWH three times in a year.
34.25: You do not slaughter the blood of My sacrifice with a fermented thing; and the sacrifice of the Celebration of the Passover does not remain until morning.
34.26: You bring the first of the first-fruits of the land into the house of your God YHWH. You do not boil a kid in its mother’s milk.”
34.27: And YHWH says to Moses, “Write these words for yourself, for I have made a covenant with you and with Israel according to the tenor of these words.”
34.28: And he is there with YHWH forty days and forty nights; he has not eaten bread, and he has not drunk water; and he writes on the tablets the matters of the covenant—the Ten Commandments.
34.29: And it comes to pass, when Moses is coming down from Mount Sinai (and the two tablets of the Testimony [are] in the hand of Moses in his coming down from the mountain), that Moses has not known that the skin of his face has shone in His speaking with him,
34.30: and Aaron sees—all the sons of Israel also—Moses, and behold, the skin of his face has shone, and they are afraid of coming near to him.
34.31: And Moses calls to them, and Aaron and all the princes in the congregation return to him, and Moses speaks to them;
34.32: and afterward all the sons of Israel have come near, and he charges them with all that YHWH has spoken with him in Mount Sinai.
34.33: And Moses finishes speaking with them, and puts a veil on his face;
34.34: and in the going in of Moses before YHWH to speak with Him, he turns aside the veil until his coming out; and he has come out and has spoken to the sons of Israel that which he is commanded;
34.35: and the sons of Israel have seen the face of Moses, that the skin of the face of Moses has shone, and Moses has put back the veil on his face until his going in to speak with Him.

35.1: And Moses assembles all the congregation of the sons of Israel and says to them, “These [are] the things which YHWH has commanded—to do them:
35.2: [For] six days work is done, and on the seventh day there is a holy [day] for you, a Sabbath of rest to YHWH; any who does work in it is put to death;
35.3: you do not burn a fire in any of your dwellings on the Sabbath day.”
35.4: And Moses speaks to all the congregation of the sons of Israel, saying, “This [is] the thing which YHWH has commanded, saying,
35.5: Take a raised-offering for YHWH from among you; everyone whose heart [is] willing brings it [as] the raised-offering of YHWH: gold, and silver, and bronze,
35.6: and blue, and purple, and scarlet, and linen, and goats’ [hair],
35.7: and rams’ skins made red, and tachashim skins, and shittim wood,
35.8: and oil for the light, and spices for the anointing oil, and for the spice-incense,
35.9: and shoham stones, and stones for settings, for an ephod, and for a breastplate.
35.10: And all the wise-hearted among you come in, and make all that YHWH has commanded:
35.11: the Dwelling Place, its tent, and its covering, its hooks, and its boards, its bars, its pillars, and its sockets,
35.12: the Ark and its poles, the propitiatory covering, and the veil of the covering,
35.13: the table and its poles, and all its vessels, and the Bread of the Presentation,
35.14: and the lampstand for the light, and its vessels, and its lamps, and the oil for the light,
35.15: and the altar of incense, and its poles, and the anointing oil, and the spice-incense, and the covering of the opening at the opening of the Dwelling Place,
35.16: the altar of burnt-offering and the bronze grate which it has, its poles, and all its vessels, the laver and its base,
35.17: the hangings of the court, its pillars, and their sockets, and the covering of the gate of the court,
35.18: the pins of the Dwelling Place, and the pins of the court, and their cords,
35.19: the colored garments, to do service in the holy place, the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons to act as priest in.”
35.20: And all the congregation of the sons of Israel go out from the presence of Moses,
35.21: and they come in—every man whom his heart has lifted up, and everyone whom his spirit has made willing—they have brought in the raised-offering of YHWH for the work of the Tent of Meeting, and for all its service, and for the holy garments.
35.22: And they come in—the men with the women—every willing-hearted one—they have brought in nose-ring, and earring, and seal-ring, and necklace, all golden goods, even everyone who has waved a wave-offering of gold to YHWH.
35.23: And every man with whom has been found blue, and purple, and scarlet, and linen, and goats’ [hair], and rams’ skins made red, and tachashim skins, have brought [them] in;
35.24: everyone lifting up a raised-offering of silver and bronze has brought in the raised-offering of YHWH; and everyone with whom has been found shittim wood for any work of the service brought [it] in.
35.25: And every wise-hearted woman has spun with her hands, and they bring in yarn—of the blue, and the purple, [and] the scarlet—and the linen;
35.26: and all the women whose heart has lifted them up in wisdom, have spun the goats’ [hair].
35.27: And the princes have brought in the shoham stones, and the stones for settings, for the ephod, and for the breastplate,
35.28: and the spices, and the oil for the light, and for the anointing oil, and for the spice-incense;
35.29: every man and woman of the sons of Israel (whom their heart has made willing to bring in for all the work which YHWH commanded to be done by the hand of Moses) brought in a willing-offering to YHWH.
35.30: And Moses says to the sons of Israel, “See, YHWH has called Bezaleel, son of Uri, son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, by name,
35.31: and He fills him [with] the Spirit of God, in wisdom, in understanding, and in knowledge, and in all work,
35.32: even to devise inventions to work in gold, and in silver, and in bronze,
35.33: and in a carving of stones for settings, and in a carving of wood to work in any work of design.
35.34: And He has put [it] in his heart to direct, he and Aholiab, son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan;
35.35: He has filled them with wisdom of heart to do every work, of engraver, and designer, and embroiderer (in blue, and in purple, in scarlet, and in linen), and weaver, who does any work, and of designers of designs.”

36.1: And Bezaleel, and Aholiab, and every wise-hearted man, in whom YHWH has given wisdom and understanding to know to do every work of the service of the holy place, have done according to all that YHWH commanded.
36.2: And Moses calls to Bezaleel, and to Aholiab, and to every wise-hearted man in whose heart YHWH has given wisdom, everyone whom his heart lifted up, to come near to the work to do it.
36.3: And they take from before Moses all the raised-offering which the sons of Israel have brought in for the work of the service of the holy place to do it; and still they have brought to him a willing-offering morning by morning.
36.4: And all the wise men, who are doing all the work of the holy place, each come from his work which they are doing,
36.5: and speak to Moses, saying, “The people are multiplying to bring in more than sufficient for the service of the work which YHWH commanded [us] to do.”
36.6: And Moses commands, and they cause a voice to pass over through the camp, saying, “Do not let man or woman make anymore work for the raised-offering of the holy place”; and the people are restrained from bringing,
36.7: and the work has been sufficient for them, for all the work, to do it, and to leave.
36.8: And all the wise-hearted ones among the doers of the work make the Dwelling Place; he has made them [with] ten curtains of twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet, [with] cherubim, the work of a designer.
36.9: The length of one curtain [is] twenty-eight by the cubit, and the breadth of one curtain [is] four by the cubit; one measure [is] for all the curtains.
36.10: And he joins the five curtains to one another, and the [other] five curtains he has joined to one another;
36.11: and he makes loops of blue on the edge of one curtain, at the end, in the joining; so he has made in the edge of the outmost curtain, in the joining of the second;
36.12: he has made fifty loops in the first curtain, and he has made fifty loops in the end of the curtain which [is] in the joining of the second; the loops are taking hold on one another.
36.13: And he makes fifty hooks of gold, and joins the curtains to one another by the hooks, and the Dwelling Place is one.
36.14: And he makes curtains of goats’ [hair] for a tent over the Dwelling Place; eleven curtains he has made them;
36.15: the length of one curtain [is] thirty by the cubit, and the breadth of one curtain [is] four cubits; one measure [is] for the eleven curtains;
36.16: and he joins the five curtains apart, and the six curtains apart.
36.17: And he makes fifty loops on the outer edge of the curtain, in the joining; and he has made fifty loops on the edge of the curtain which is joining the second;
36.18: and he makes fifty hooks of bronze to join the tent—to be one;
36.19: and he makes a covering for the tent of rams’ skins made red, and a covering of tachashim skins above.
36.20: And he makes the boards for the Dwelling Place of shittim wood, standing up;
36.21: ten cubits [is] the length of the [one] board, and a cubit and a half the breadth of the [one] board;
36.22: two handles [are] to one board, joined to one another; so he has made for all the boards of the Dwelling Place.
36.23: And he makes the boards for the Dwelling Place; twenty boards for the south side southward;
36.24: and he has made forty sockets of silver under the twenty boards: two sockets under one board for its two handles, and two sockets under the other board for its two handles.
36.25: And for the second side of the Dwelling Place, for the north side, he has made twenty boards,
36.26: and their forty sockets of silver: two sockets under one board, and two sockets under the other board;
36.27: and for the sides of the Dwelling Place westward, he has made six boards;
36.28: and he has made two boards for the corners of the Dwelling Place, in the two sides;
36.29: and they have been twins below, and together they are twins at its head, at one ring; so he has done to both of them at the two corners;
36.30: and there have been eight boards; and their sockets of silver [are] sixteen sockets, two sockets under one board.
36.31: And he makes bars of shittim wood: five for the boards of the first side of the Dwelling Place,
36.32: and five bars for the boards of the second side of the Dwelling Place, and five bars for the boards of the Dwelling Place, for the sides westward;
36.33: and he makes the middle bar to enter into the midst of the boards from end to end;
36.34: and he has overlaid the boards with gold, and he has made their rings of gold, places for bars, and he overlays the bars with gold.
36.35: And he makes the veil of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and twined linen; he has made it [with] cherubim—the work of a designer;
36.36: and he makes four pillars of shittim [wood] for it, and overlays them with gold; their pegs [are] of gold; and he casts four sockets of silver for them.
36.37: And he makes a covering for the opening of the tent, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and twined linen, the work of an embroiderer,
36.38: also its five pillars, and their pegs; and he overlaid their tops and their fillets [with] gold, and their five sockets [are] bronze.

37.1: And Bezaleel makes the Ark of shittim wood; two cubits and a half its length, and a cubit and a half its breadth, and a cubit and a half its height;
37.2: and he overlays it with pure gold inside and outside, and makes a wreath of gold for it all around;
37.3: and he casts four rings of gold for it on its four feet, even two rings on its one side, and two rings on its second side;
37.4: and he makes poles of shittim wood, and overlays them with gold,
37.5: and he brings in the poles into the rings, by the sides of the Ark, to carry the Ark.
37.6: And he makes a propitiatory covering of pure gold, two cubits and a half its length, and a cubit and a half its breadth;
37.7: and he makes two cherubim of gold; he has made them of beaten work at the two ends of the propitiatory covering—
37.8: one cherub at the end on this [side] and one cherub at the end on that [side]; he has made the cherubim from [above] the propitiatory covering, at its two ends;
37.9: and the cherubim are spreading out wings on high, covering over the propitiatory covering with their wings, and their faces [are] toward one another; the faces of the cherubim have been toward the propitiatory covering.
37.10: And he makes the table of shittim wood; two cubits its length, and a cubit its breadth, and a cubit and a half its height,
37.11: and overlays it with pure gold, and makes a wreath of gold for it all around.
37.12: And he makes a border for it of a handbreadth around, and makes a wreath of gold around for its border;
37.13: and he casts four rings of gold for it, and puts the rings on the four corners which [are] at its four feet;
37.14: the rings have been close by the border, places for poles to carry the table.
37.15: And he makes the poles of shittim wood, and overlays them with gold, to carry the table;
37.16: and he makes the vessels which [are] on the table, its dishes, and its bowls, and its cups, and the cups by which they pour out, of pure gold.
37.17: And he makes the lampstand of pure gold; he has made the lampstand of beaten work, its base, and its branch, its calyxes, its knobs, and its flowers, have been of the same;
37.18: and six branches are coming out of its sides, three branches of the lampstand out of its one side, and three branches of the lampstand out of its second side;
37.19: three calyxes, made like almonds, in one branch, a knob and a flower; and three calyxes, made like almonds, in another branch, a knob and a flower; so for the six branches which are coming out of the lampstand.
37.20: And in the lampstand [are] four calyxes, made like almonds, its knobs, and its flowers,
37.21: and a knob under the two branches of the same, and a knob under the two branches of the same, and a knob under the two branches of the same, [are] for the six branches which are coming out of it;
37.22: their knobs and their branches have been of the same; all of it one beaten work of pure gold.
37.23: And he makes its seven lamps, and its snuffers, and its snuff-dishes, of pure gold;
37.24: he has made it of a talent of pure gold, and with all its vessels.
37.25: And he makes the incense-altar of shittim wood; a cubit its length, and a cubit its breadth (square), and two cubits its height; its horns have been of the same;
37.26: and he overlays it with pure gold, around its top and its sides, and its horns; and he makes a wreath of gold for it all around;
37.27: and he has made two rings of gold for it under its wreath, at its two corners, at its two sides, for places for poles to carry it with them.
37.28: And he makes the poles of shittim wood, and overlays them with gold;
37.29: and he makes the holy anointing oil, and the pure spice-incense—work of a compounder.

38.1: And he makes the altar of burnt-offering of shittim wood; five cubits its length, and five cubits its breadth (square), and three cubits its height;
38.2: and he makes its horns on its four corners; its horns have been of the same; and he overlays it with bronze;
38.3: and he makes all the vessels of the altar, the pots, and the shovels, and the sprinkling-pans, the forks, and the fire-pans; he has made all its vessels of bronze.
38.4: And he makes a bronze grate of network for the altar, under its rim beneath, to its midst;
38.5: and he casts four rings for the four ends of the bronze grate—places for bars;
38.6: and he makes the poles of shittim wood, and overlays them with bronze;
38.7: and he brings in the poles into the rings on the sides of the altar, to carry it with them; he made it hollow [with] boards.
38.8: And he makes the laver of bronze, and its base of bronze, with the mirrors of the women assembling, who have assembled at the opening of the Tent of Meeting.
38.9: And he makes the court: at the south side southward, the hangings of the court of twined linen, one hundred by the cubit,
38.10: their pillars [are] twenty, and their bronze sockets twenty, the pegs of the pillars and their fillets [are] silver;
38.11: and at the north side, one hundred by the cubit, their pillars [are] twenty, and their sockets of bronze twenty; the pegs of the pillars and their fillets [are] silver;
38.12: and at the west side [are] hangings, fifty by the cubit; their pillars [are] ten, and their sockets ten; the pegs of the pillars and their fillets [are] silver;
38.13: and at the east side eastward, fifty cubits.
38.14: The hangings on the side [are] fifteen cubits, their pillars three, and their sockets three,
38.15: and at the second side at the gate of the court, on this [side] and on that [side]—hangings of fifteen cubits, their pillars three, and their sockets three;
38.16: all the hangings of the court around [are] of twined linen,
38.17: and the sockets for the pillars of bronze, the pegs of the pillars and their fillets of silver, and the overlaying of their tops of silver, and all the pillars of the court are filleted with silver.
38.18: And the covering of the gate of the court [is] the work of an embroiderer, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and twined linen; and twenty cubits [is] the length, and the height with the breadth [is] five cubits, corresponding to the hangings of the court;
38.19: and their pillars [are] four, and their sockets of bronze four, their pegs [are] of silver, and the overlaying of their tops and their fillets [are] of silver;
38.20: and all the pins for the Dwelling Place, and for the court all around, [are] of bronze.
38.21: These are the numberings of the Dwelling Place (the Dwelling Place of Testimony), which has been numbered by the command of Moses, the service of the Levites, by the hand of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest.
38.22: And Bezaleel son of Uri, son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, has made all that YHWH commanded Moses;
38.23: and with him [is] Aholiab son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, an engraver, and designer and embroiderer in blue, and in purple, and in scarlet, and in linen.
38.24: All the gold which is prepared for the work in all the work of the holy place (and it is the gold of the wave-offering) [is] twenty-nine talents, and seven hundred and thirty shekels, by the shekel of the holy place.
38.25: And the silver of those numbered of the congregation [is] one hundred talents, and one thousand and seven hundred and seventy-five shekels, by the shekel of the holy place;
38.26: a bekah for the counted head (half a shekel, by the shekel of the holy place), for everyone who is passing over to those numbered, from a son of twenty years and upwards, for six hundred thousand and three thousand and five hundred and fifty.
38.27: And one hundred talents of silver are for casting the sockets of the holy place, and the sockets of the veil; one hundred sockets for the hundred talents, a talent for a socket;
38.28: and [from] the one thousand and seven hundred and seventy-five [shekels] he has made pegs for the pillars, and overlaid their tops, and filleted them.
38.29: And the bronze of the wave-offering [is] seventy talents, and two thousand and four hundred shekels;
38.30: and he makes with it the sockets of the opening of the Tent of Meeting, and the bronze altar, and the bronze grate which it has, and all the vessels of the altar,
38.31: and the sockets of the court all around, and the sockets of the gate of the court, and all the pins of the Dwelling Place, and all the pins of the court all around.

39.1: And of the blue, and the purple, and the scarlet, they made colored garments, to minister in the holy place; and they make the holy garments which [are] for Aaron, as YHWH has commanded Moses.
39.2: And he makes the ephod, of gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and twined linen,
39.3: and they expand the plates of gold, and have cut off wires to work in the midst of the blue, and in the midst of the purple, and in the midst of the scarlet, and in the midst of the linen—the work of a designer;
39.4: they have made shoulder-pieces for it, joining; it is joined at its two ends.
39.5: And the girdle of his ephod which [is] on it is of the same, according to its work, of gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and twined linen, as YHWH has commanded Moses.
39.6: And they prepare the shoham stones, set [with] filigrees of gold, engraved with engravings of a signet—the names of the sons of Israel on [them];
39.7: and he sets them on the shoulders of the ephod—stones of memorial for the sons of Israel, as YHWH has commanded Moses.
39.8: And he makes the breastplate, the work of a designer, like the work of the ephod, of gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and twined linen;
39.9: it has been square; they have made the breastplate double, a span its length, and a span its breadth, doubled.
39.10: And they fill four rows of stones in it: a row of a sardius, a topaz, and a carbuncle [is] the first row;
39.11: and the second row an emerald, a sapphire, and a diamond;
39.12: and the third row an opal, an agate, and an amethyst;
39.13: and the fourth row a beryl, an onyx, and a jasper—set [with] filigrees of gold in their settings.
39.14: And the stones, according to the names of the sons of Israel, are twelve, according to their names, engravings of a signet, each according to his name, for the twelve tribes.
39.15: And they make wreathed chains on the breastplate, [the] work of thick bands of pure gold;
39.16: and they make two filigrees of gold, and two rings of gold, and put the two rings on the two ends of the breastplate,
39.17: and they put the two thick bands of gold on the two rings on the ends of the breastplate;
39.18: and they have put the two ends of the two thick bands on the two filigrees, and they put them on the shoulders of the ephod, toward the front of its face.
39.19: And they make two rings of gold, and set [them] on the two ends of the breastplate, on its border, which [is] on the side of the ephod within;
39.20: and they make two rings of gold, and put them on the two shoulders of the ephod below, in front of its front, close by its joining, above the girdle of the ephod;
39.21: and they bind the breastplate by its rings to the rings of the ephod, with a ribbon of blue, to be above the girdle of the ephod, and the breastplate is not loosed from off the ephod, as YHWH has commanded Moses.
39.22: And he makes the upper robe of the ephod, the work of a weaver, completely of blue;
39.23: and the opening of the upper robe [is] in its midst, as the opening of a [linen] habergeon, [with] a border for its opening all around; it is not torn;
39.24: and they make on the hems of the upper robe pomegranates of blue, and purple, and scarlet, twined.
39.25: And they make bells of pure gold, and put the bells in the midst of the pomegranates, on the hems of the upper robe, all around, in the midst of the pomegranates;
39.26: a bell and a pomegranate [and] a bell and a pomegranate [are] on the hems of the upper robe all around, to minister in, as YHWH has commanded Moses.
39.27: And they make the coats of linen, the work of a weaver, for Aaron and for his sons,
39.28: and the turban of linen, and the beautiful caps of linen, and the linen trousers, of twined linen,
39.29: and the girdle of twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet, the work of an embroiderer, as YHWH has commanded Moses.
39.30: And they make the flower of the holy crown of pure gold, and write a writing on it, engravings of a signet: “Holy to YHWH”;
39.31: and they put a ribbon of blue on it, to put [it] on the turban above, as YHWH has commanded Moses.
39.32: And all the service of the Dwelling Place of the Tent of Meeting is completed; and the sons of Israel do according to all that YHWH has commanded Moses; so they have done.
39.33: And they bring in the Dwelling Place to Moses, the tent, and all its vessels, its hooks, its boards, its bars, and its pillars, and its sockets;
39.34: and the covering of rams’ skins, which are made red, and the covering of tachashim skins, and the veil of the covering;
39.35: the Ark of the Testimony and its poles, and the propitiatory covering;
39.36: the table, all its vessels, and the Bread of the Presentation;
39.37: the pure lampstand, its lamps, the lamps of arrangement, and all its vessels, and the oil for the light.
39.38: And the golden altar, and the anointing oil, and the spice-incense, and the covering of the opening of the tent;
39.39: the bronze altar and the bronze grate which it has, its poles, and all its vessels, the laver and its base;
39.40: the hangings of the court, its pillars, and its sockets; and the covering for the gate of the court, its cords, and its pins; and all the vessels of the service of the Dwelling Place, for the Tent of Meeting;
39.41: the colored clothes to minister in the holy place, the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons, to act as priest in.
39.42: According to all that YHWH has commanded Moses, so the sons of Israel have done all the service;
39.43: and Moses sees all the work, and behold, they have done it as YHWH has commanded; so they have done. And Moses blesses them.

40.1: And YHWH speaks to Moses, saying,
40.2: “On the first day of the month, in the first month, you raise up the Dwelling Place of the Tent of Meeting,
40.3: and have set the Ark of the Testimony [in] there, and have covered over the Ark with the veil,
40.4: and have brought in the table, and set its arrangement in order, and have brought in the lampstand, and caused its lamps to go up.
40.5: And you have put the golden altar for incense before the Ark of the Testimony, and have put the covering of the opening to the Dwelling Place,
40.6: and have put the altar of the burnt-offering before the opening of the Dwelling Place of the Tent of Meeting,
40.7: and have put the laver between the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and have put water [in] there.
40.8: And you have set the court all around, and have placed the covering of the gate of the court,
40.9: and have taken the anointing oil, and anointed the Dwelling Place, and all that [is] in it, and hallowed it, and all its vessels, and it has been holy;
40.10: and you have anointed the altar of the burnt-offering, and all its vessels, and sanctified the altar, and the altar has been most holy;
40.11: and you have anointed the laver and its base, and sanctified it.
40.12: And you have brought Aaron and his sons near to the opening of the Tent of Meeting, and have bathed them with water;
40.13: and you have clothed Aaron with the holy garments, and anointed him, and sanctified him, and he has acted as priest to Me.
40.14: And you bring his sons near, and have clothed them with coats,
40.15: and anointed them as you have anointed their father, and they have acted as priests to Me, and their anointing has been to them for a continuous priesthood throughout their generations.”
40.16: And Moses does according to all that YHWH has commanded him; so he has done.
40.17: And it comes to pass, in the first month, in the second year, on the first of the month, the Dwelling Place has been raised up;
40.18: and Moses raises up the Dwelling Place, and sets its sockets, and places its boards, and places its bars, and raises its pillars,
40.19: and spreads the tent over the Dwelling Place, and puts the covering of the tent on it above, as YHWH has commanded Moses.
40.20: And he takes and puts the Testimony into the Ark, and sets the poles on the Ark, and puts the propitiatory covering on the Ark above;
40.21: and brings the Ark into the Dwelling Place, and places the veil of the covering, and covers over the Ark of the Testimony, as YHWH has commanded Moses.
40.22: And he puts the table in the Tent of Meeting, on the side of the Dwelling Place northward, at the outside of the veil,
40.23: and sets in order the arrangement of bread on it, before YHWH, as YHWH has commanded Moses.
40.24: And he puts the lampstand in the Tent of Meeting, opposite the table, on the side of the Dwelling Place southward,
40.25: and causes the lamps to go up before YHWH, as YHWH has commanded Moses.
40.26: And he sets the golden altar in the Tent of Meeting, before the veil,
40.27: and makes incense on it—spice-incense—as YHWH has commanded Moses.
40.28: And he sets the covering [at] the opening of the Dwelling Place,
40.29: and he has set the altar of the burnt-offering [at] the opening of the Dwelling Place of the Tent of Meeting, and causes the burnt-offering to go up on it, and the present, as YHWH has commanded Moses.
40.30: And he puts the laver between the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and puts water [in] there for washing,
40.31: and Moses and Aaron and his sons have washed their hands and their feet at the same;
40.32: in their going into the Tent of Meeting, and in their drawing near to the altar, they wash, as YHWH has commanded Moses.
40.33: And he raises up the court all around the Dwelling Place, and around the altar, and places the covering of the gate of the court; and Moses completes the work.
40.34: And the cloud covers the Tent of Meeting, and the glory of YHWH has filled the Dwelling Place;
40.35: and Moses has not been able to go into the Tent of Meeting, for the cloud has dwelt on it, and the glory of YHWH has filled the Dwelling Place.
40.36: And in the going up of the cloud from off the Dwelling Place the sons of Israel journey in all their journeys;
40.37: and if the cloud does not go up then they do not journey, until the day of its going up.
40.38: For the cloud of YHWH [is] on the Dwelling Place by day, and fire is in it by night, before the eyes of all the house of Israel in all their journeys.

1.1: And YHWH calls to Moses, and speaks to him out of the Tent of Meeting, saying,
1.2: “Speak to the sons of Israel, and you have said to them: Any man of you, when he brings an offering near to YHWH out of the livestock—out of the herd or out of the flock—you bring your offering near.
1.3: If his offering [is] a burnt-offering out of the herd, he brings a male near, a perfect one, to the opening of the Tent of Meeting; he brings it near at his pleasure before YHWH;
1.4: and he has laid his hand on the head of the burnt-offering, and it has been accepted for him to make atonement for him;
1.5: and he has slaughtered the son of the herd before YHWH; and sons of Aaron, the priests, have brought the blood near, and sprinkled the blood around the altar, which [is] at the opening of the Tent of Meeting.
1.6: And he has stripped the burnt-offering, and has cut it into its pieces;
1.7: and the sons of Aaron the priest have put fire on the altar, and arranged wood on the fire;
1.8: and sons of Aaron, the priests, have arranged the pieces, with the head and the fat, on the wood, which [is] on the fire, which [is] on the altar;
1.9: and he washes its innards and its legs with water; and the priest has made incense with the whole on the altar, a burnt-offering, a fire-offering of refreshing fragrance to YHWH.
1.10: And if his offering [is] out of the flock—out of the sheep or out of the goats—he brings a male near, a perfect one, for a burnt-offering,
1.11: and he has slaughtered it by the side of the altar northward, before YHWH; and sons of Aaron, the priests, have sprinkled its blood around the altar;
1.12: and he has cut it into its pieces, and its head and its fat, and the priest has arranged them on the wood, which [is] on the fire, which [is] on the altar;
1.13: and he washes the innards and the legs with water, and the priest has brought the whole near, and has made incense on the altar; it [is] a burnt-offering, a fire-offering of refreshing fragrance to YHWH.
1.14: And if his offering [is] a burnt-offering out of the bird to YHWH, then he has brought his offering near out of the turtle-doves or out of the young pigeons,
1.15: and the priest has brought it near to the altar, and has wrung off its head, and has made incense on the altar, and its blood has been wrung out by the side of the altar;
1.16: and he has turned aside its crop with its feathers, and has cast it near the altar, eastward, to the place of ashes;
1.17: and he has cleaved it with its wings (he does not separate [it]), and the priest has made it an incense on the altar, on the wood, which [is] on the fire; it [is] a burnt-offering, a fire-offering of refreshing fragrance to YHWH.”

2.1: “And when a person brings an offering near, a present to YHWH, [and] his offering is of flour, then he has poured oil on it, and has put frankincense on it;
2.2: and he has brought it to the sons of Aaron, the priests, and one [of the priests] has taken from there the fullness of his hand of its flour and of its oil, besides all its frankincense, and the priest has made incense with its memorial on the altar, a fire-offering of refreshing fragrance to YHWH;
2.3: and the remnant of the present [is] for Aaron and for his sons, most holy, of the fire-offerings of YHWH.
2.4: And when you bring an offering near, a present baked in an oven, [it is of] unleavened cakes of flour mixed with oil, or thin unleavened cakes anointed with oil.
2.5: And if your offering [is] a present [made] on the griddle, it is of flour, mixed with oil, unleavened;
2.6: divide it into parts, and you have poured oil on it; it [is] a present.
2.7: And if your offering [is] a present [made] on the frying-pan, it is made of flour with oil,
2.8: and you have brought in the present which is made of these to YHWH, and [one] has brought it near to the priest, and he has brought it near to the altar,
2.9: and the priest has lifted up from the present its memorial, and has made incense on the altar, a fire-offering of refreshing fragrance to YHWH;
2.10: and the remnant of the present [is] for Aaron and for his sons, most holy, of the fire-offerings of YHWH.
2.11: No present which you bring near to YHWH is made fermented, for you do not make incense [as] a fire-offering to YHWH with any leaven or any honey.
2.12: An offering of first-[fruits]—you bring them near to YHWH, but they do not go up on the altar for refreshing fragrance.
2.13: And every offering—your present—you season with salt, and you do not let the salt of the covenant of your God cease from your present; you bring salt near with all your offerings.
2.14: And if you bring a present of first-fruits near to YHWH, you bring the present of your first-fruits near of green ears, roasted with fire, beaten out [grain] of a fruitful field,
2.15: and you have put oil on it, and laid frankincense on it, [for] it [is] a present;
2.16: and the priest has made incense with its memorial from its beaten out [grain], and from its oil, besides all its frankincense, [as] a fire-offering to YHWH.”

3.1: “And if his offering [is] a sacrifice of peace-offerings, if he is bringing near out of the herd, whether male or female, he brings a perfect one near before YHWH,
3.2: and he has laid his hand on the head of his offering, and has slaughtered it at the opening of the Tent of Meeting, and sons of Aaron, the priests, have sprinkled the blood around the altar.
3.3: And he has brought near from the sacrifice of the peace-offerings a fire-offering to YHWH, the fat which is covering the innards, and all the fat which [is] on the innards,
3.4: and the two kidneys, and the fat which [is] on them, which [is] on the flanks, and the redundance on the liver above the kidneys—he turns it aside,
3.5: and sons of Aaron have made it an incense on the altar, on the burnt-offering which [is] on the wood, which [is] on the fire, [as] a fire-offering of refreshing fragrance to YHWH.
3.6: And if his offering [is] out of the flock for a sacrifice of peace-offerings to YHWH, male or female, he brings a perfect one near;
3.7: if he is bringing a sheep near [for] his offering, then he has brought it near before YHWH,
3.8: and has laid his hand on the head of his offering, and has slaughtered it before the Tent of Meeting, and sons of Aaron have sprinkled its blood around the altar.
3.9: And he has brought near from the sacrifice of the peace-offerings a fire-offering to YHWH, its fat, the whole fat tail close by the bone—he turns it aside, and the fat which is covering the innards, and all the fat which [is] on the innards,
3.10: and the two kidneys, and the fat which [is] on them, which [is] on the flanks, and the redundance on the liver above the kidneys—he turns it aside,
3.11: and the priest has made it an incense on the altar [as] bread of a fire-offering to YHWH.
3.12: And if his offering [is] a goat, then he has brought it near before YHWH,
3.13: and has laid his hand on its head, and has slaughtered it before the Tent of Meeting, and sons of Aaron have sprinkled its blood around the altar;
3.14: and he has brought his offering near from it, a fire-offering to YHWH, the fat which is covering the innards, and all the fat which [is] on the innards,
3.15: and the two kidneys, and the fat which [is] on them, which [is] on the flanks, and the redundance on the liver above the kidneys—he turns it aside,
3.16: and the priest has made them an incense on the altar [as] bread of a fire-offering, for refreshing fragrance; all the fat [is] YHWH’s.
3.17: [This is] a continuous statute throughout your generations in all your dwellings: you do not eat any fat or any blood.”

4.1: And YHWH speaks to Moses, saying,
4.2: “Speak to the sons of Israel, saying, When a person sins through ignorance against any of the commands of YHWH [regarding things] which are not to be done, and has done [something] against one of these—
4.3: if the priest who is anointed sins according to the guilt of the people, then he has brought near for his sin which he has sinned a bullock, a son of the herd, a perfect one, to YHWH, for a sin-offering,
4.4: and he has brought in the bullock to the opening of the Tent of Meeting before YHWH, and has laid his hand on the head of the bullock, and has slaughtered the bullock before YHWH.
4.5: And the priest who is anointed has taken of the blood of the bullock, and has brought it into the Tent of Meeting,
4.6: and the priest has dipped his finger in the blood, and sprinkled of the blood seven times before YHWH, at the front of the veil of the holy place;
4.7: and the priest has put of the blood on the horns of the altar of spice-incense before YHWH, which [is] in the Tent of Meeting, and he pours out all the blood of the bullock at the foundation of the altar of the burnt-offering, which [is] at the opening of the Tent of Meeting.
4.8: And he lifts up from it all the fat of the bullock of the sin-offering, the fat which is covering over the innards, and all the fat which [is] on the innards,
4.9: and the two kidneys, and the fat which [is] on them, which [is] on the flanks, and the redundance on the liver above the kidneys—he turns it aside,
4.10: as it is lifted up from the ox of the sacrifice of the peace-offerings; and the priest has made them an incense on the altar of the burnt-offering.
4.11: And the skin of the bullock, and all its flesh, with its head, and with its legs, and its innards, and its dung—
4.12: he has even brought out the whole bullock to the outside of the camp, to a clean place, to the place of the pouring out of the ashes, and he has burned it on the wood with fire; it is burned beside the place of the pouring out of the ashes.
4.13: And if all the congregation of Israel errs ignorantly, and the thing has been hidden from the eyes of the assembly, and they have done [something against] one of all the commands of YHWH [regarding things] which are not to be done, and have been guilty;
4.14: when the sin which they have sinned concerning it has been known, then the assembly has brought a bullock near, a son of the herd, for a sin-offering, and they have brought it in before the Tent of Meeting;
4.15: and the elderly of the congregation have laid their hands on the head of the bullock, before YHWH, and [one] has slaughtered the bullock before YHWH.
4.16: And the priest who is anointed has brought in of the blood of the bullock to the Tent of Meeting,
4.17: and the priest has dipped his finger in the blood, and has sprinkled seven times before YHWH at the front of the veil,
4.18: and he puts [some] of the blood on the horns of the altar which [is] before YHWH, which [is] in the Tent of Meeting; and he pours out all the blood at the foundation of the altar of the burnt-offering, which [is] at the opening of the Tent of Meeting;
4.19: and he lifts up all its fat from it, and has made incense on the altar.
4.20: And he has done to the bullock as he has done to the bullock of the sin-offering, so he does to it; and the priest has made atonement for them, and it has been forgiven them;
4.21: and he has brought out the bullock to the outside of the camp, and has burned it as he has burned the first bullock; it [is] a sin-offering of the assembly.
4.22: When a prince sins, and has done [something against] one of all the commands of his God YHWH [regarding things] which are not to be done, through ignorance, and has been guilty,
4.23: or his sin wherein he has sinned has been made known to him, then he has brought in his offering, a kid of the goats, a male, a perfect one,
4.24: and he has laid his hand on the head of the goat, and has slaughtered it in the place where he slaughters the burnt-offering before YHWH; it [is] a sin-offering.
4.25: And the priest has taken of the blood of the sin-offering with his finger, and has put [it] on the horns of the altar of the burnt-offering, and he pours out its blood at the foundation of the altar of the burnt-offering,
4.26: and he makes incense on the altar with all its fat, as the fat of the sacrifice of the peace-offerings; and the priest has made atonement for him because of his sin, and it has been forgiven him.
4.27: And if any person of the people of the land sins through ignorance, by his doing [something against] one of the commands of YHWH [regarding things] which are not to be done, and has been guilty,
4.28: or his sin which he has sinned has been made known to him, then he has brought in his offering, a kid of the goats, a perfect one, a female, for his sin which he has sinned,
4.29: and he has laid his hand on the head of the sin-offering, and has slaughtered the sin-offering in the place of the burnt-offering.
4.30: And the priest has taken of its blood with his finger, and has put [it] on the horns of the altar of the burnt-offering, and he pours out all its blood at the foundation of the altar,
4.31: and he turns aside all its fat, as the fat has been turned aside from off the sacrifice of the peace-offerings, and the priest has made incense on the altar for refreshing fragrance to YHWH; and the priest has made atonement for him, and it has been forgiven him.
4.32: And if he brings in a sheep [for] his offering, a female for a sin-offering, he brings in a perfect one,
4.33: and he has laid his hand on the head of the sin-offering, and has slaughtered it for a sin-offering in the place where he slaughters the burnt-offering.
4.34: And the priest has taken of the blood of the sin-offering with his finger, and has put [it] on the horns of the altar of the burnt-offering, and he pours out all its blood at the foundation of the altar,
4.35: and he turns aside all its fat, as the fat of the sheep is turned aside from the sacrifice of the peace-offerings, and the priest has made them an incense on the altar, according to the fire-offerings of YHWH, and the priest has made atonement for him, for his sin which he has sinned, and it has been forgiven him.”

5.1: “And when a person sins, and has heard the voice of an oath, and he [is] witness, or has seen, or has known—if he does not declare [it], then he has borne his iniquity.
5.2: Or when a person comes against anything unclean, or against a carcass of an unclean beast, or against a carcass of unclean livestock, or against a carcass of an unclean teeming creature, and it has been hidden from him, then he [is] unclean and guilty;
5.3: or when he comes against [the] uncleanness of man, even any of his uncleanness whereby he is unclean, and it has been hidden from him, and he has known, then he has been guilty.
5.4: Or when a person swears, speaking wrongfully with the lips to do evil, or to do good, even anything which man speaks wrongfully with an oath, and it has been hid from him—when he has known then he has been guilty of one of these;
5.5: and it has been when he is guilty of one of these, that he has confessed concerning that which he has sinned,
5.6: and has brought in his guilt-offering to YHWH for his sin which he has sinned, a female out of the flock, a lamb, or a kid of the goats, for a sin-offering, and the priest has made atonement for him because of his sin.
5.7: And if his hand does not reach to the sufficiency of a lamb, then he has brought in his guilt-offering—he who has sinned—two turtle-doves or two young pigeons to YHWH, one for a sin-offering and one for a burnt-offering;
5.8: and he has brought them to the priest, and has brought near that which [is] for a sin-offering first, and has wrung off its head from its neck, and does not separate [it],
5.9: and he has sprinkled of the blood of the sin-offering on the side of the altar, and that which is left of the blood is wrung out at the foundation of the altar; it [is] a sin-offering.
5.10: And he makes the second a burnt-offering, according to the ordinance, and the priest has made atonement for him because of his sin which he has sinned, and it has been forgiven him.
5.11: And if his hand does not reach to two turtle-doves, or to two young pigeons, then he has brought in his offering—he who has sinned—a tenth of an ephah of flour for a sin-offering; he puts no oil on it, nor does he put frankincense on it, for it [is] a sin-offering,
5.12: and he has brought it to the priest, and the priest has taken a handful from it of the fullness of his hand—its memorial—and has made incense on the altar, according to the fire-offerings of YHWH; it [is] a sin-offering.
5.13: And the priest has made atonement for him, for his sin which he has sinned against one of these, and it has been forgiven him, and [the remnant] has been for the priest, like the present.”
5.14: And YHWH speaks to Moses, saying,
5.15: “When a person commits a trespass, and has sinned through ignorance against the holy things of YHWH, then he has brought in his guilt-offering to YHWH, a ram, a perfect one, out of the flock, at your valuation [in] silver—shekels by the shekel of the holy place—for a guilt-offering.
5.16: And that which he has sinned against the holy thing he repays, and is adding to it its fifth, and has given it to the priest, and the priest makes atonement for him with the ram of the guilt-offering, and it has been forgiven him.
5.17: And when any person sins, and has done [something against] one of all the commands of YHWH [regarding things] which are not to be done, and has not known, then he has been guilty, and has borne his iniquity.
5.18: Then he has brought in a ram, a perfect one, out of the flock, at your valuation, for a guilt-offering, to the priest; and the priest has made atonement for him, for his ignorance in which he has erred and he has not known, and it has been forgiven him;
5.19: it [is] a guilt-offering; he has certainly been guilty before YHWH.”

6.1: And YHWH speaks to Moses, saying,
6.2: “When any person sins, and has committed a trespass against YHWH, and has lied to his fellow concerning a deposit, or concerning fellowship, or concerning violent robbery, or has oppressed his fellow;
6.3: or has found a lost thing, and has lied concerning it, and has sworn to a falsehood, concerning one of all [these] which man does, sinning in them:
